In NBA history, the player who scored the most points in a single game is Wilt Chamberlain. He set the record by scoring 100 points for the Philadelphia Warriors in a game against the New York Knicks on March 2, 1962. This is a significant achievement and a historic moment in NBA history, as no other player has come close to surpassing this record.

Wilt Chamberlain's scoring prowess extended beyond just this single game. He also holds the record for the highest scoring average in a single season, with an incredible 50.4 points per game during the 1961-62 season. This further solidifies his place as one of the greatest scorers in NBA history.

Additionally, it's important to note that while Wilt Chamberlain holds the record for most points scored in a single game, Kareem Abdul-Jabbar is the NBA's all-time leading scorer in total career points. This distinction showcases the longevity and consistency of Abdul-Jabbar's scoring ability over the course of his career.

Answer:
Wilt Chamberlain
